name: IPM Newsroom
title: Campus To Coast A University Of Illinois Urbana Champaign Grad Student Investigates The Gambias Fishmeal Crisis And Its Toll On West African Communities
content: About Us Agriculture Education Environment Politics WILL Call Student Newsroom Donate Now **Campus to coast: A University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign grad student investigates The Gambia’s fishmeal crisis and its toll on West African communities** By Arielle Raveney and Kennedy Vincent June 6, 2025 The Gambia’s coastal communities rely heavily on fishing for their livelihoods. Large-scale fisheries and fishmeal projects have expanded along the coast. These projects promise economic growth but also create social and environmental challenges. Dialogue sits down with a University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign doctoral student born in America and raised in The Gambia. She investigates how these projects impact local communities and marine ecosystems from the perspective of blue justice, a global initiative that addresses unfair fishing practices. __GUESTS:Fatou H. Jobe Doctoral student, University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign WILL and the Illinois Newsroom are committed to bringing you in-depth, relevant coverage that keeps you informed and engages you with our community and state.
